Audit
Auditing improves the data integrity level in the database.
Data changes are recorded automatically in the System and do not require user actions. The audit log permanently stores all data changes, including:
system updates
user actions in the System
data changes made by a particular user at a specific time
The audit log organizes a single storage for all changes in the database. Choose the
Audit
menu item to view the log.
The log of most types of audit is viewed after the following menu items are selected: Administration → Audit.
A complete list of all types of auditing is available in
the object type registry
.
The System supports the following types of audit:
Actions audit
(recording user actions in the System);
Changes audit
(recording data changes made to the System by the user);
Update audit (recording the
Install updates
operation with extended data);
Permissions audit (recording actions related to access permissions);
Access groups audit (recording the changes of access groups and whether users belong to them);
Session audit
.
Actions audit
This type of audit records all user actions performed in the System.
The audit is recorded in the parameters:
User – the user who performed the action;
Office – the office of the user who performed the action;
Object – the object within which the action was performed (in the audit registry, the parameter contains a link to open the object profile in a modal window);
Action type – the modified object attribute;
Comment;
Date – the action date and time;
Event success – the parameter that demonstrates whether the action was completed successfully;
The user with permissions to perform the action – the user under whose permissions the action was performed.
For example, with installing updates under a user with no permissions to change the object, but with permissions to execute "Installing updates"
permissions
, this parameter is filled with the "admin" value, in some cases, the user performing the action is recorded to the parameter.
In the case of multiple xrefs:execas.adoc[user substitutions], the end user under whose permissions the action is performed will be fixed as the parameter "The user with permissions to perform the action".
Changes audit
This audit type that records each saved change for all attributes of the System.
To go to the audit registry, select the menu items: Administration → Audit → Changes audit.
In addition, the changes audit of each System object can be viewed by clicking the audit view button
, which is located on the control panel in
registry
and in
the object profile
.
The visibility of the
button is controlled by the presence of  “View audit”
permissions
.
The object type, the object for which the change audit should be displayed, as well as the start and end dates of the period of data display in the change register can be defined in the corresponding fields.
The data presented in the registry can be exported by clicking the
button, to update the registry data click the
button.
In the audit registry, the data is presented in the form of columns:
User – the user who made the change;
Ofiice – the department of the user who made the change;
Object – the object in which changes have been made (in the audit registry, the parameter contains a link to open the object card in a modal window);
Attribute type – the attribute whose value has been changed;
Change – the name of the object being changed (to view the changed attribute value, open the profle of the audit object);
Date – the change date and time.
Session audit
The session audit is created only when the user is successfully authorized in the application.
Viewing the audit of user sessions is available in the registry of the "Audit.Session"  object type. [SYS_AU_SESSION].
The data in the audit log can be
sorted/filtered
by the following parameters:
by
to the user
;
by
user ID
;
by information from the provider;
The value of the "Information from the provider" parameter is formed depending on
identification provider
:
domain authentication retrieves the domain name;
password and oauth authentication uses the corresponding account ID.
by
employee
;
by IP address;
by the date of creation of the audit session.
Reports on audit data and access permissions
To facilitate working with a large amount of information on data changes in the System, audit data reports were configured.
Access to reports is available through the following menu items: "Administration" → "Reports on audit data and access permissions".
Next, select a report and specify filtering parameters:
Audit of actions by user
- a report containing information about user activities in the System.
Filtering is available by user, action type, start and end dates.
The specified period must not exceed 31 days.
Audit of actions by object
- records actions performed on an object.
Filtering is available by object type, object, start and end dates.
The specified period must not exceed 31 days.
Audit of changes by object
- records object data changes.
Filtering is available by object type, object, start and end dates.
Audit of updates for the period
- a report listing all "Update installation" operations performed in the System.
Filtering is available by start and end dates.
Audit of access masks
- records changes in access masks for users in the System.
Filtering is available by start and end dates.
Audit of access group assignment
- a report containing information on access group assignments for users in the System.
Filtering is available by start and end dates.
Audit of other actions with permissions
- records actions related to access permissions.
Filtering is available by start and end dates.
Audit of system login
- a report containing information on user sessions in the System.
Filtering is available by user, start and end dates.
Audit of integrations with external systems
This type of audit records the results of the following events:
Interaction with external databases (each query is logged).
Operation of the
message queue listener
.
Operation of the e-mail message listener.
Webhook requests.
HTTP interactions:
Connections to external GreenData environments;
requests to
data sources
/
data receivers
in ETL (excluding dummy sources);
with the
DaData
service;
with the MangoOffice service;
with the Ahunter service.
This type of audit can be viewed by opening the
registry
of the "Audit. Integration with external systems" object type [SYS_AU_INTEGRATION].
The recording of
body
/
sql
/
emailText
data in the audit may be limited by the number of characters specified in the
configuration file
.
